title: CPU Post-Silicon Performance Engineer
summary: Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, hard-working people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all Apple Hardware products. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it! Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product. In this highly visible role, you will be at the center of a chip design effort working with all disciplines, with a critical impact on getting functional products to millions of customers quickly.
description:
• Collaborate with software and system teams to identify and trace and profile critical workloads for CPU performance and power
• Develop representative benchmarks for CPU critical workloads
• Capture key workloads from silicon for CPU performance evaluation
• Identify hardware and software performance bottlenecks
• Work closely with the Architecture, Micro-Architecture, and RTL teams in identification of solutions
• Run and analyze workloads on simulators and prototype devices as well as work on developing and automating performance analysis infrastructure
key_qualifications:
Minimum BS and 10+ years of relevant industry experience
Experience with CPU architecture and micro-architecture concepts
Experience working in a performance modeling environment
Experience with tracing on silicon for performance evaluation
Proficient in scripting languages such as Python or Perl
Comfortable with C and C++
Knowledge and experience with common performance benchmarks and workloads
Knowledge of OS internals and compiler technology is a plus
Experience in analyzing application performance
education_experience: Minimum BS and 10+ years of relevant industry experience
